templates.name: AKS Starterkit
templates.description: The AKS Starterkit provides application teams with a pre-configured Kubernetes environment. It includes two Kubernetes namespaces (dev&prod), a Git repository, a CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions, and a secure container registry integration.

resources.type: Whether to archive github repository when destroying the terraform resource, or delete it. Defaults to true (archive).
Information about the creator of the resources who will be assigned Project Admin role
Full platform identifier of the AKS Namespace platform.
UUID of the GitHub Actions connector building block definition version.
GitHub organization name. Used only for display purposes.
UUID of the GitHub repository building block definition.
UUID of the GitHub repository building block definition version.
Visibility of the GitHub repository (e.g., public, private).
AKS Landing zone identifier for the development tenant.
AKS Landing zone identifier for the production tenant.
This name will be used for the created projects, app subdomain and GitHub repository.

YAML configuration for project tags that will be applied to dev and prod projects. Expected structure:
yaml
dev:
  key1:
    - "value1"
    - "value2"
  key2:
    - "value3"
prod:
  key1:
    - "value4"
  key2:
    - "value5"
    - "value6"
GitHub handle of the user who will be assigned as the repository admin. Delete building block definition input if not needed.
n/a
Link to the dev environment Angular app
URL of the created GitHub repository
Link to the prod environment Angular app
Summary with next steps and insights into created resources

templates.name: Agentic Coding Sandbox
templates.description:
A composition building block that provides developers with a sandboxed AWS environment
to access agentic coding tools like Claude via AWS Bedrock, with automatic budget alerts
and region enablement for AI model access.

resources.type: Monthly budget amount. You will receive an alert when the budget is exceeded.

YAML configuration for landing zone and building blocks. Expected structure:
yaml
landing_zone:
  landing_zone_identifier: "my-landing-zone"
  platform_identifier: "my-platform"
budget_alert_building_block:
  definition_uuid: "uuid-here"
  definition_version: 1
enable_eu_south_2_region_building_block:
  definition_uuid: "uuid-here"
  definition_version: 1
project:
  default_tags:
    environment: "sandbox"
    cost_center: "engineering"
  owner_tag_key: "project_owner"  # optional, if not set no project owner tag will be set
meshStack username of the project contact. This should be an email.
Identifier for the owning workspace

inputs.type: Monthly budget amount. You will receive an alert when the budget is exceeded.

YAML configuration for landing zone and building blocks. Expected structure:
yaml
landing_zone:
  landing_zone_identifier: "my-landing-zone"
  platform_identifier: "my-platform"
budget_alert_building_block:
  definition_uuid: "uuid-here"
  definition_version: 1
enable_eu_south_2_region_building_block:
  definition_uuid: "uuid-here"
  definition_version: 1
project:
  default_tags:
    environment: "sandbox"
    cost_center: "engineering"
  owner_tag_key: "project_owner"  # optional, if not set no project owner tag will be set
meshStack username of the project contact. This should be an email.
Identifier for the owning workspace

templates.name: AWS Budget Alert
templates.description: Sets up budget alerts for an AWS account to monitor spending and prevent cost overruns.

resources.type: target account id where the budget alert should be created
The precise percentage of the monthly budget at which you wish to activate the alert upon reaching. E.g. '15' for 15% or '120' for 120%
The name of the role to assume in target account identified by account\_id
The AWS partition to use. e.g. aws, aws-cn, aws-us-gov
Name of the budget alert rule
Comma-separated list of emails of the users who should receive the Budget alert. e.g. 'foo@example.com, bar@example.com'
The forecasted percentage of the monthly budget at which you wish to activate the alert upon reaching. E.g. '15' for 15% or '120' for 120%
Set the monthly budget for this account in USD.
The amount of the budget
The ID of the budget
The name of the budget

inputs.type: target account id where the budget alert should be created
The precise percentage of the monthly budget at which you wish to activate the alert upon reaching. E.g. '15' for 15% or '120' for 120%
The name of the role to assume in target account identified by account\_id
The AWS partition to use. e.g. aws, aws-cn, aws-us-gov
Name of the budget alert rule
Comma-separated list of emails of the users who should receive the Budget alert. e.g. 'foo@example.com, bar@example.com'
The forecasted percentage of the monthly budget at which you wish to activate the alert upon reaching. E.g. '15' for 15% or '120' for 120%
Set the monthly budget for this account in USD.

outputs.type: The amount of the budget
The ID of the budget
The name of the budget

templates.name: Enable Opt-In Regions
templates.description: The building block enables you to enable AWS regions that require explicit opt-in for your AWS account. This is particularly useful for managing access to newer AWS regions or regions with specific compliance requirements.

resources.type: The ID of the target account where the opt-in region will be managed
The ARN of the role in the organization management account that the building block will assume to manage opt-in regions
Whether the region is enabled
The region name to manage (e.g., ap-southeast-3, me-central-1, af-south-1)
The region opt status
The region name

inputs.type: The ID of the target account where the opt-in region will be managed
The ARN of the role in the organization management account that the building block will assume to manage opt-in regions
Whether the region is enabled
The region name to manage (e.g., ap-southeast-3, me-central-1, af-south-1)

outputs.type: The region opt status
The region name

templates.name: AKS Cluster
templates.description: Provision a production-grade Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) cluster with Azure AD, OIDC, Workload Identity, Log Analytics and custom VNet using Terraform.

resources.type: Object ID of the Azure AD group used for AKS admin access. If null, Azure AD RBAC will not be configured.
Name of the AKS cluster
Allow gateway transit from hub to spoke. Set to true if hub has a gateway and you want spoke to use it.
DNS prefix for the AKS cluster
IP address for Kubernetes DNS service (must be within service\_cidr)
Enable auto-scaling for the default node pool
Resource group name of the existing VNet. Only used when vnet\_name is provided. Defaults to the AKS resource group if not specified.
Resource group name of the hub virtual network. Required when private\_cluster\_enabled is true and connecting to a hub.
Subscription ID of the hub network. Required when private\_cluster\_enabled is true and connecting to a hub.
Name of the hub virtual network to peer with. Required when private\_cluster\_enabled is true and connecting to a hub.
Kubernetes version for the AKS cluster
Azure region where resources will be deployed
Name of the Log Analytics Workspace. If null, no LAW or monitoring will be created.
Number of days to retain logs in Log Analytics Workspace
Maximum number of nodes for auto-scaling (set to enable auto-scaling)
Minimum number of nodes for auto-scaling (set to enable auto-scaling)
Network plugin to use (azure or kubenet)
Network policy to use (azure, calico, or cilium)
Initial number of nodes in the default node pool
OS disk size in GB for the node pool
Enable private cluster (API server only accessible via private endpoint)
Enable public FQDN for private cluster (allows public DNS resolution but API server remains private)
Private DNS Zone ID for private cluster. Use 'System' for Azure-managed zone, or provide custom zone ID. Only used when private\_cluster\_enabled is true.
Name of the resource group to create for the AKS cluster
CIDR for Kubernetes services (must not overlap with VNet or subnet)
Address prefix for the AKS subnet (only used if subnet\_name is not provided)
Name of the subnet for AKS. If not provided, a new subnet will be created.
Tags to apply to all resources
Size of the virtual machines for the default node pool
Address space for the AKS virtual network (only used if vnet\_name is not provided)
Name of the virtual network for AKS. If not provided, a new VNet will be created.
Client ID of the AKS system-assigned managed identity
Kubeconfig raw output
Log Analytics Workspace ID
OIDC issuer URL for federated identity and workload identity setup
Subnet ID used by AKS

inputs.type: Object ID of the Azure AD group used for AKS admin access. If null, Azure AD RBAC will not be configured.
Name of the AKS cluster
Allow gateway transit from hub to spoke. Set to true if hub has a gateway and you want spoke to use it.
DNS prefix for the AKS cluster
IP address for Kubernetes DNS service (must be within service\_cidr)
Enable auto-scaling for the default node pool

Name of the Log Analytics Workspace. If null, no LAW or monitoring will be created.
Number of days to retain logs in Log Analytics Workspace
Maximum number of nodes for auto-scaling (set to enable auto-scaling)
Minimum number of nodes for auto-scaling (set to enable auto-scaling)
Network plugin to use (azure or kubenet)
Network policy to use (azure, calico, or cilium)
Initial number of nodes in the default node pool
OS disk size in GB for the node pool

Name of the resource group to create for the AKS cluster
CIDR for Kubernetes services (must not overlap with VNet or subnet)

templates.name: Azure Container Registry
templates.description: Provides a production-grade Azure Container Registry for storing and managing Docker container images and OCI artifacts with private networking support.

resources.type: Name of the Azure Container Registry (must be globally unique, alphanumeric only)
Enable admin user for basic authentication (not recommended for production)
Principal ID of the AKS managed identity to grant AcrPull access. If provided, AcrPull role will be assigned automatically.
Allow gateway transit from hub to spoke. Set to true if hub has a gateway and you want spoke to use it.
List of IP ranges (CIDR) allowed to access the ACR
Enable anonymous pull access (allows unauthenticated pulls)
Enable dedicated data endpoints (Premium SKU only)
Resource group name of the existing VNet. Only used when vnet\_name is provided. Defaults to the ACR resource group if not specified.
Resource group name of the hub virtual network. Required when private\_endpoint\_enabled is true and connecting to a hub.
Subscription ID of the hub network. Required when private\_endpoint\_enabled is true and connecting to a hub.
Name of the hub virtual network to peer with. Required when private\_endpoint\_enabled is true and connecting to a hub.
Azure region where resources will be deployed
Whether to allow trusted Azure services to bypass network rules (AzureServices or None)
Private DNS Zone ID for private endpoint. Use 'System' for Azure-managed zone, or provide custom zone ID. Only used when private\_endpoint\_enabled is true.
Enable private endpoint for ACR (Premium SKU required)
Enable public network access to the ACR
Name of the resource group to create for the ACR
Number of days to retain untagged manifests (Premium SKU only, 0 to disable)
SKU tier for the ACR (Basic, Standard, Premium). Premium required for private endpoints.
Address prefix for the private endpoint subnet (only used if subnet\_name is not provided)
Name of the subnet for private endpoint. If not provided, a new subnet will be created.
Tags to apply to all resources
Enable content trust policy (Premium SKU only)
Use remote gateways from hub VNet. Set to true only if hub has a VPN/ExpressRoute gateway configured.
Address space for the VNet (only used if vnet\_name is not provided)
Name of the virtual network for private endpoint. If not provided, a new VNet will be created.
Enable zone redundancy for the ACR (Premium SKU only, available in select regions)
The ID of the Azure Container Registry
The login server URL for the Azure Container Registry
The name of the Azure Container Registry
Admin password for the Azure Container Registry (only available when admin\_enabled is true)
Admin username for the Azure Container Registry (only available when admin\_enabled is true)
ID of the private DNS zone (when System-managed)
Private IP address of the ACR private endpoint
Name of the resource group containing the ACR
ID of the subnet used for private endpoint
ID of the virtual network used for private endpoint
